page.title: 10LUDFORD _ HIGH STREET FARM
page.content: Typical Farm of this area. 189 acres around farmhouse and another 106 else_ where. All arable and crops of Winter Wheat & Barley, Oil Seed Rape & Peas in roughly equal proportions. 8 Acres of pasture used occasionally when calves bought at week old & fed to strong stores level, say 9_10 months & then sold to go to Marshes area to fatten. Because of elevated position cattle could never fatten satisfactor_ _ily and similarly Spring sown cereal crops would never give a good return as they could be up to 3 weeks later than in warmer areas.For these reasons it is known as a 'Late Farm'. Local saying is 'If eyesight good enough one could see the Urals'.Farmer is Vintage Motorcycle enthusiast and he and Wife active community leaders _ Chuch Warden and she President of Women's Institute &c.
